DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Hematopoietic Engraftment Intent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the hematopoietic cell product (graft) infusion was intended to produce hematopoietic engraftment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Hematopoietic Engraftment Intent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion._Pertaining to or related to the formation of blood cells._The establishment of viable, functional grafted tissue within the body of a host._An anticipated outcome that is the meaning or purpose for actions taken, thus guiding your planned actions.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Infusion Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the formation of blood cells.:The establishment of viable, functional grafted tissue within the body of a host.:Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to or related to the formation of blood cells.
The establishment of viable, functional grafted tissue within the body of a host.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
